alert.note: Alert for Park (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 12:50AM MDT until June 22 at 2:30AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in central Colorado, Clear Creek and Park. In northeast Colorado, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 400 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bergen Creek, Cub Creek, Troublesome Creek, South Platte River, Blue Creek, Wisp Creek, Vance Creek, Mount Vernon Creek, Maxwell Creek, Elk Creek, North Turkey Creek, Turkey Creek, Last Resort Creek, North Elk Creek, Indian Creek, Dutch Creek, North Fork South Platte River, North Fork Deer Creek, South Turkey Creek, Bear Creek, Deer Creek and Crow Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Denver, Lakewood, northern Littleton, southwestern Golden, Evergreen, Morrison, Aspen Park, Conifer, Indian Hills, Kittredge, Tiny Town, Idledale, Red Rocks Park, Brookvale, Pine Junction, Harris Park, Highland Park, Wah Keeney Park, Genesee and Shaffers Crossing.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
